name: The Enniskillen Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't be fooled by the exterior of this property, it is bizarre and does not seem to be a classy hotel from the outside. However once inside the hotel is decorated to a very high standard, if a little dark in places. The bedroom is not overly large, even the superior double was quite small, but was very nice and absolutely clean. The bathroom was lovely, with great little touches. There was coffee, tea, water all complimentary in the rooms. Even the hair dyer was of very good quality, not like the one in many other hotels. The bar and restaurant were very inviting and the breakfast was excellent. The cooked selection in particular was really impressive and there was a variety of morning newspapers as all at breakfast. The location is ideal for walking into the town, a short 5min walk will have you at bars, restaurants and shops.
reviews.title: A surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having never been to Enniskillen before we had no idea what to expect or where the hotel was. We were thoroughly impressed with this hotel from the moment we arrived!
reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our arrival we were greeted by a lovely receptionist and checked in very quickly. We booked the whiskey tasting option for our stay and on check-in we confirmed our drink options for that night agreeing to do whiskey tasting on night one and cocktail making on night two.
reviews.title: Only Mediocre

reviews.text: We found the hotel to be very very clean and everything is brand spanking new! A very modern monochrome theme runs through the hotel making it feel very classy and modern.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room number was 104 and was a superior double.
reviews.title: Excellent - luxury at an amazing price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good - very polite staff. Central. Cosy. Decent bathroom and shower. The bad - a horrific grey colour throughout the hotel that makes it look very drab and depressing. Screaming and roaring at 4am from some inconsiderate guests that woke many people (I know because a few guests mentioned it at the breakfast). My wife was giving a lecture at a local college the following morning, and was awake for hours because of the noise. She never got back to sleep after it. The receptionist wasn't prepared to apologise for it. She just said that the hotel was powerless to do anything about it. I dunno. Surely a night porter should get involved ? Maybe he was unaware of it ? The breakfast was decent, but the breakfast room very cramped. Overall it was very pricey here for one night. I probably would seek out other accommodation the next time.
reviews.title: Had good and bad points

reviews.text: From doing the booking to checking out we had a wonderful stay, every member of staff was exceptional and trained to a very high standard, the bar food was excellent and the cocktail making lessons 1stclass. The bedrooms and hotel decor very chic and taste full done. Would recommend this to everyone and can't wait to go back. Thank you for a wonderful stay
reviews.title: 1st class hotel and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed her when attending an evening wedding party at the lough erne resort. staff were very friendly without being pushy. quirky decor which works really well. rooms small but very comfortable bed and soft furnishings. bathroom/shower kitted out to high spec and fluffy towels. Breakfast next morning was excellent and would be delighted to have an excuse to go back. easy walking distance to eateries if you dont want to eat in but lovely bar area where you could have a quiet drink
reviews.title: a little gem

reviews.text: Formerly known as the Fort Lodge, the hotel as been recently renovated to the highest of standards. What an amazing transformation. Tastefully decorated throughout. Very classy indeed. Extremely pleasant courteous staff who made you feel so welcome. The food we ate was of the highest quality. The room in which we stayed as good as I have I have ever seen. Lovely little touches which I'll let you discover for yourself. If you are looking for somewhere to stay in Fermanagh this is as good as it gets.
reviews.title: A Short Stay

reviews.text: J MCBRIDE LONDON
reviews.title: Top class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently visited your hotel to eat not to stay,food was gorgeous 2 extremely bar staff served us and made sure everything was perfect for us, the atmosphere was so warm, at the minute we are planning to stay in your hotel. Customer service is the most important thing in a hotel, well done. Will see you soon.
reviews.title: Kilkenny couple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed over while attending a wedding at loch erne, found hotel with sat nav no problem, hotel car park was full but public car park a short walk away, lady on reception very helpful and chatty, got to room and was impressed, modern and trendy, big comfy bed and great bathroom with awesome shower. Had dinner in the Wilde bar! Great service and fantastic food, good value for money, with simple but effective menu, had the sliders, which was 6 mini cheese burgers.... Lovely. Went to the wedding, came back and had a great nights sleep, breakfast was very good, and checking out was painless, overall very impressed with hotel. Would go back again
reviews.title: Top class hotel
Excellent
reviews.text: Stayed last weekend, room was perfect, clean, comfortable and cosy. Food was top quality and service was excellent. Staff very friendly and helpful. Handy to the town and parking onsite. I'll definitely be back.

Stayed overnight following a small retirement function in the hotel. Room was excellent, large comfortable bed, fridge with complimentary water, lots of storage. Good sized bathroom with power shower. Evening meal and cooked breakfast very, very good. But most impressive feature is the staff. They were all so friendly, professional and helpful. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Overnight Stay

reviews.text: As soon as you arrive you are greeted with a warm and friendly welcome. The rooms are excellent, I stayed at the hotel for a function. The staff can't do enough for you and are always making sure that you are comfortable and enjoying yourself. The food was superb as was the breakfast.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel and staff

reviews.text: I have been here a few times but I ate in here tonight with 2 children, the food and service was fantastic great place all round. The value was super and the food was not only presented well it tasted fantastic plus the staff were very very good , I will definitely be back :)
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: We (2 couples) stayed for 2 nights over Easter weekend.
reviews.title: Previously - this was a dive of a placeThat's definitely not the case now

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel before being renovated,and vowed never to return.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel

reviews.text: Now that its been renovated :
reviews.title: Great New Hotel

reviews.text: It was clean, stylish, close to enniskillen to walk in or home.
reviews.title: Problems but handled well

description: We offer a brand new hotel experience unlike any other, where the people make the place, and make you feel right at home. Situated in Enniskillen town, our rooms offer contemporary sophistication; whether you are a visiting for business or pleasure. And that’s before you’ve tried one of our specialty whiskeys or cocktails!
